Lems.description: Defines both abstract cell models (e.g. _izhikevichCell_, adaptive exponential integrate and fire cell, _adExIaFCell_), point conductance based cell models (_pointCellCondBased_, _pointCellCondBasedCa_) and cells models (_cell_) which specify the _morphology_ (containing _segment_s) and _biophysicalProperties_ separately.

ComponentType.name: baseCell
ComponentType.description: Base type of any cell which can be used in a population

ComponentType.name: baseCellMembPot
ComponentType.description: Any cell which has a membrane potential _v with voltage units. These will emit _spike events.

ComponentType.name: baseCellMembPotDL
ComponentType.description: Any cell which has a dimensioness membrane potential, _V. These will emit _spike events.

ComponentType.name: baseChannelPopulation
ComponentType.description: Base type for any current produced by a population of channels, all of type _ionChannel

ComponentType.name: channelPopulation
ComponentType.description: Population of _number ohmic ion channels. These each produce a conductance _channelg across a reversal potential _erev, giving a total current _i.

ComponentType.name: channelPopulationNernst
ComponentType.description: Population of channels with a time varying reversal potential _erev determined by Nernst equation. Hard coded for Ca only! Work in progress!!

Constant.name: R
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: zCa
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: F
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

ComponentType.name: baseChannelDensity
ComponentType.description: Base type for current distributed on an area of a cell

ComponentType.name: baseChannelDensityCond
ComponentType.description: Base type for distributed conductances on an area of a cell producing a (not necessarily ohmic) current

ComponentType.name: channelDensity
ComponentType.description: Specifies a time varying ohmic conductance density, _gDensity, which is distributed on an area of the cell with fixed reversal potential _erev producing a current density _iDensity

ComponentType.name: channelDensityNernst
ComponentType.description: Specifies a time varying conductance density, _gDensity, which is distributed on an area of the cell, producing a current density _iDensity and whose reversal potential is calculated from the Nernst equation. Hard coded for Ca only! Work in progress!!

Constant.name: R
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: zCa
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: F
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

ComponentType.name: channelDensityGHK
ComponentType.description: Specifies a time varying conductance density, _gDensity, which is distributed on an area of the cell, producing a current density _iDensity and whose reversal potential is calculated from the Goldman Hodgkin Katz equation. Hard coded for Ca only! Work in progress!

Constant.name: R
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: zCa
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: F
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

DerivedVariable.name: iDensity
DerivedVariable.value: -1 * channelf * permeability * zCa * F * K * v * ( caConc - (caConcExt * expKv) ) / (1 - expKv)

ComponentType.name: pointCellCondBased
ComponentType.description: Simple model of a conductance based cell, with no separate morphology element, just an absolute capacitance _C, and a set of channel populations

ComponentType.name: pointCellCondBasedCa
ComponentType.description: TEMPORARY: Point cell with conductances and Ca concentration info. Not yet fully tested!!!

ComponentType.name: distal
ComponentType.description: Point furthest from the soma in a segment

ComponentType.name: proximal
ComponentType.description: Point closest to the soma in a segment. Note, if the proximal point is equal to the distal point of the parent segment, proximal can be omitted.

ComponentType.name: parent
ComponentType.description: Specifies the segment which is this segment's parent

ComponentType.name: segment
ComponentType.description: A segment defines the smallest unit within a possibly branching structure (_morphology_), such as a dendrite or axon. The shape is given by the _proximal_ and _distal_ points. If _proximal_ is missing, the proximal point is assumed to be the _distal_ point of the parent. _parent_ specifies the parent segment. The first segment (no _parent_) usually represents the soma. NOTE: LEMS does not yet support multicompartmental modelling, so the Dynamics here is only appropriate for single compartment modelling.

DerivedVariable.name: length
DerivedVariable.value: sqrt(((dx - px) * (dx - px) + (dy - py) * (dy - py) + (dz - pz) * (dz - pz))/(LEN * LEN)) * LEN

ComponentType.name: segmentGroup
ComponentType.description: A method to describe a group of _segment_s in a _morphology_

ComponentType.name: member
ComponentType.description: A single identified _segment_ which is part of the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: from
ComponentType.description: Specifies which _segment_ distal from which to calculate the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: to
ComponentType.description: Specifies which _segment_ up to which to calculate the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: include
ComponentType.description: Include all members of another _segmentGroup_ in this

ComponentType.name: path
ComponentType.description: Include all the segments between those specified by _from_ and _to_, inclusive

ComponentType.name: subTree
ComponentType.description: Include all the segments distal to that specified by _from_ in the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: morphology
ComponentType.description: The collection of _segment_s which specify the 3D structure of the cell, along with a number of _segmentGroup_s

ComponentType.name: specificCapacitance
ComponentType.description: Capacitance per unit area

ComponentType.name: initMembPotential
ComponentType.description: Explicitly set initial membrane potential for the cell

ComponentType.name: spikeThresh
ComponentType.description: Membrane potential at which to emit a spiking event. Note, usually the spiking event will not be emitted again until the membrane potential has fallen below this value and rises again to cross it in a positive direction

ComponentType.name: membraneProperties
ComponentType.description: Properties specific to the membrane, such as the _populations of channels, _channelDensities, _specificCapacitance, etc.

ComponentType.name: biophysicalProperties
ComponentType.description: The biophysical properties of the _cell_, including the _membraneProperties_ and the _intracellularProperties_

ComponentType.name: intracellularProperties
ComponentType.description: Biophysical properties related to the intracellular space within the _cell_, such as the _resistivity_ and the list of _species_ present. _caConc and _caConcExt are explicitly exposed here to facilitate accessing these values from other Components, even though _caConcExt is clearly not an intracellular property

ComponentType.name: resistivity
ComponentType.description: The resistivity, or specific axial resistance, of the cytoplasm

ComponentType.name: concentrationModel
ComponentType.description: Base for any model of an ion concentration which changes with time. Internal, _concentration, and external, _extConcentration, values for the concentration of the ion (specified by _species) are given.

ComponentType.name: decayingPoolConcentrationModel
ComponentType.description: Model of buffering of concentration of an ion (currently hard coded to be calcium, due to requirement for _iCa) which has a baseline level _restingConc and tends to this value with time course _decayConstant. The ion is assumed to occupy a shell inside the membrane of thickness _shellThickness.

ComponentType.name: species
ComponentType.description: Description of a chemical species identified by _ion, which has internal, _concentration, and external, _extConcentration values for its concentration

ComponentType.name: cell
ComponentType.description: Cell with _segment_s specified in a _morphology_ element along with details on its _biophysicalProperties_. NOTE: this can only be correctly simulated using LEMS when there is a single segment in the cell, and _v of this cell represents the membrane potential in that isopotential segment!!!

ComponentType.name: baseCellMembPotCap
ComponentType.description: Any cell with a membrane potential _v with voltage units and a membrane capacitance _C. Also defines exposed value _iSyn for current due to external synapses and _iMemb for total current crossing membrane (normally channel currents plus _iSyn)

Parameter.name: C
Parameter.description: Total capacitance of the cell membrane

Exposure.name: iSyn
Exposure.description: Total current due to synaptic inputs

Exposure.name: iMemb
Exposure.description: Total current crossing the cell membrane

ComponentType.name: baseIaf
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for an integrate and fire cell which emits a spiking event at membrane potential _thresh and and resets to _reset

Parameter.name: thresh
Parameter.description: The membrane potential at which to emit a spiking event and reset voltage

Parameter.name: reset
Parameter.description: The value the membrane potential is reset to on spiking

ComponentType.name: iafTauCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell which returns to its leak reversal potential of _leakReversal with a time course _tau

ComponentType.name: iafTauRefCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell which returns to its leak reversal potential of _leakReversal with a time course _tau. It has a refractory period of _refract after spiking

ComponentType.name: baseIafCapCell
ComponentType.description: Base Type for all Integrate and Fire cells with a capacitance _C, threshold _thresh and reset membrane potential _reset

ComponentType.name: iafCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell with capacitance _C, _leakConductance and _leakReversal

ComponentType.name: iafRefCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell with capacitance _C, _leakConductance, _leakReversal and refractory period _refract

ComponentType.name: izhikevichCell
ComponentType.description: Cell based on the model of Izhikevich, see http://izhikevich.org/publications/spikes.htm

TimeDerivative.value: (0.04 * v^2 / MVOLT + 5 * v + (140.0 - U + ISyn) * MVOLT)/MSEC

ComponentType.name: adExIaFCell
ComponentType.description: Model based on Brette R and Gerstner W (2005) Adaptive Exponential Integrate-and-Fire Model as an Effective Description of Neuronal Activity. J Neurophysiol 94:3637-3642

DerivedVariable.name: iMemb
DerivedVariable.value: -1 * gL * (v - EL) + gL * delT * exp((v - VT) / delT) - w + I + iSyn

ComponentType.name: fitzHughNagumoCell
ComponentType.description: Simple dimensionless model of spiking cell from FitzHugh and Nagumo. Based on http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/FitzHugh-Nagumo_model
